image.altText: A caramel coloured mother labradoodle feeding her puppies.

props.synopsis: Whistleblowers who told the RSPCA about conditions at a now-shut Tasmanian labradoodle breeding facility say they are in fear of being prosecuted themselves, with the animal welfare group announcing a review into possible charges.

title.children: 'That is crazy': RSPCA seeks to pursue former puppy farm workers who blew the lid on conditions

image.altText: People playing pokie machines at the Cherokee Casino in Siloam Spring,

props.synopsis: The man behind Tasmania's promised cashless gaming card says the "backbone of every MP is under pressure" due to a concerted campaign against it by the state's hospitality lobby.

title.children: MPs under pressure from gambling lobby over harm minimisation plan, Liberal MP claims

image.altText: Female basketball players embrace, seen from behind.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's championship team wants to establish a professional women's team in either the north or north-west, as it looks to expand into the state's basketball heartland.

title.children: 'The north deserves it': JackJumpers plan women's team expansion to either Launceston or Devonport

image.altText: Side on view of a horde of swimmers rushing into water.

props.synopsis: After a more muted affair this year, the organisers of the iconic Dark Mofo festival in Tasmania are ready to make their return in 2025. Here's what people can expect.

title.children: Dark Mofo organisers prepare to 'bathe the city in red' with event's full return in Hobart in 2025

image.altText: A close-up photograph of Ricardo Barbaro, a man with short dark hair and a neat beard.

props.synopsis: Ricardo Barbaro stabbed 26-year-old mother Ellie Price in her South Melbourne apartment before fleeing interstate.

title.children: Melbourne man who stabbed Tasmanian mum Ellie Price to death jailed for 28 years

image.altText: A Tasmania Police officer stands in front of a patrol car in Hobart's CBD.

props.synopsis: A senior female Tasmania Police officer has been sacked following an investigation into allegations she harassed female colleagues at a work Christmas party last year.

title.children: Female Tasmania Police inspector sacked following sexual misconduct investigation

image.altText: Male Forty-spotted Pardalote after being monitored and released

props.synopsis: They are small, busy and might be seen chasing their insect dinner in the forest canopy — that is, if you are extremely lucky enough to see one. There are fewer than 1,000 left in the wild.

title.children: Tiny, energetic and almost extinct; what will it take to save the forty-spotted pardalote?

image.altText: An elderly woman looks off into the distance as she speaks.

props.synopsis: Greens Senator Mehreen Faruqi took One Nation leader Pauline Hanson to Federal Court claiming her tweet breached the Racial Discrimination Act. The tweet was in response to a 2022 post by Ms Faruqi, who commented that she couldn't mourn someone who she described as "the leader of a racist empire".

title.children: Pauline Hanson racially discriminated against Mehreen Faruqi in 'angry personal attack' tweet, court rules

image.altText: Australian passports

props.synopsis: Government auditors slam the Australian Passport Office's handling of procurement contracts worth more than $1.5 billion

title.children: 'Clear indications of misconduct': Officials under investigation after Australian Passport Office audit

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair wearing a dark blazer answers questions from a reporter in a corridor.

props.synopsis: The shadow transport minister has conceded she made an error on her own flight upgrades as she defended Peter Dutton's travel on Gina Rinehart's plane.

title.children: McKenzie defends Dutton's relationship with Rinehart, admits she was wrong on flight upgrades

image.altText: A man in boxing gloves

props.synopsis: Australian boxing champion Jayson Tonkin is in a coma after he was found next to the body of his dead friend and fellow boxer, Joshua Goldstone, at a hotel in Thailand.

title.children: Australian boxer Jayson Tonkin in coma and British boxer found dead in hotel in Thailand

image.altText: submarine in ocean half above the water

props.synopsis: The Australian Navy has been left with just one fully operational submarine as the rest of its aging Collins-class fleet undergoes urgent repairs or await upgrades. Defence sources have confirmed to the ABC two of the Collins submarines are currently stationed in Adelaide, where there are delays to maintenance.

title.children: The Australian Navy has been left with just one fully operational submarine

image.altText: Tarnawsky speaks in the mural hall at parliament house.

props.synopsis: Richard Marles's chief of staff Jo Tarnawsky said her work situation had not changed despite writing legal letter asking for accountability two weeks ago.

title.children: Deputy PM's chief of staff remains locked out of office following bullying complaint

image.altText: Mohamed Al Fayed wears a grey jacket looking neutrally past the camera

props.synopsis: Lawyers say 400 women from the United States, Japan, Denmark, Malaysia, South Africa, Canada, the UK and Spain have come forward accusing the late billionaire of sexual misconduct in "the worst case of corporate sexual abuse of women the world has ever known".

title.children: 'A vile monster': Six Australian women among 400 people accusing late billionaire Mohamed Al Fayed of sexual assault

image.altText: A photo of a young women with long brown hair and blue eyes looking straight ahead with serious expression.

props.synopsis: Some votes in the US election won't have as much weight as people in some other states.

title.children: The US may be a democracy — but not every vote is created equal

image.altText: Donald Trump, wearing a fluoro orange vest, is seen in the cabin of a truck.

props.synopsis: As Donald Trump and Kamala Harris blitz the swing states in the final days before the US election, twin "garbage" controversies have created headaches for both sides.

title.children: How Donald Trump in a rubbish truck came to sum up US election

image.altText: A close up view of police tape, with emergency service vehicle lights in the background.

props.synopsis: A 35-year-old man who police say was arrested after breaching his court-imposed bail conditions for "serious charges" has died while in custody.

title.children: Man suffers medical episode and dies while under arrest in police custody, sparking call for more support

image.altText: With large computer screen in background, bottom half of person's face is visible facing down towards mobile phone held in hand.

props.synopsis: A new report by Our Watch has found 40 per cent of workplace leaders surveyed are unaware of their new legal obligations to prevent workplace sexual harassment. For many who experience harassment like *Jess, quitting seems like the only option.

title.children: Workplace sexual harassment is common, but many employers don't know their obligations

props.synopsis: The ATO's latest corporate tax transparency report reveals 31 per cent of companies did not pay a cent of tax. Here's the full list.

title.children: The ATO issued 124 companies with $3b in tax bills, but many still didn't pay any. Here's the list

image.altText: A group photo of the cabinet standing on the stairs of Government House.

props.synopsis: Shortly after unveiling his cabinet, the new premier was pressed on what message shutting down the Truth-telling and Healing Inquiry sent to First Nations Queenslanders.

title.children: David Crisafulli reveals Queensland cabinet, says Indigenous homeownership trumps truth-telling

props.synopsis: The Liberal Party is optimistic that it can make up ground in WA ahead of the 2025 federal and state elections as high-profile figures tour Perth this week. But does the party have what it takes to get voters over the line?

title.children: High profile former PMs Howard and Abbott in WA shows the Liberals are betting it all on the west

image.altText: Three opalised shark teeth fossils, Lightning Ridge, NSW, April 2024.

props.synopsis: In a fossil-rich pocket of northern New South Wales, two pioneering palaeontologists have spent decades digging up rare relics of the past, striking deals with collectors and opal miners and unlocking our understanding of deep geological history.

title.children: This fossil collector may have just hit the jackpot. The only question is whether to sell or save it

image.altText: A young boy smiling

props.synopsis: The family of a woman whose car collided into Melbourne primary school students, claiming the life of an 11-year-old boy, have offered their condolences to his family and say they are grief-stricken.

title.children: Family of the driver whose car collided into a Melbourne school in shock at 'overwhelming tragedy'

image.altText: People work to clear a mud-covered street with piled up cars

props.synopsis: Preliminary research shows human-caused climate change doubled the likelihood of a storm as intense as this week's deluge.

title.children: Spain's unprecedented floods could become Europe's worst storm-related disaster in five decades

image.altText: A bearded Thom Yorke, wearing a beanie, sings into a microphone from behind a bank of keys onstage

props.synopsis: The Radiohead frontman's Australian solo tour is a career-spanning fan's dream. But a disruption by a pro-Palestine protester made for a surreal ending to a sublime concert, and raises questions about the responsibility of the artist.

title.children: Thom Yorke's confrontation with a protester takes a divisive issue for Radiohead fans to boiling point

image.altText: A model scales of justice rests on top of a table, behind it is an out of focus courtroom

props.synopsis: An alleged victim of child sex abuse has in an Australian first given evidence as different identities during a trial.

title.children: Woman with multiple personalities switches identities in witness box during sex abuse trial

image.altText: Vladimir Putin, wearing a dark suit, leans on a lectern, smiling.

props.synopsis: Russia has slapped Google with a fine of $US20,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000 for blocking state media channels on YouTube.

title.children: Russia has fined Google $US20 trillion trillion trillion

image.altText: A yellow open home flag attached to a yellow for sale sign outside an apartment complex.

props.synopsis: Although national property prices increased again in October, the latest CoreLogic data suggests the housing market is cooling ahead of forecasted interest rate cuts early next year.

title.children: House prices have risen again, but there are signs of 'erring towards a buyer's market'

image.altText: Sam Hibbens wears a white collared shirt, navy suit jacket and blue stripped tie and stands with his arms folded, smiling

props.synopsis: Member for Prahran Sam Hibbins said he had breached party room rules by engaging in a consensual relationship with a staffer from his office, with the Victorian Greens leader condemning his behaviour.

title.children: Victorian Greens leader condemns behaviour of MP who resigned over relationship with staffer

image.altText: William Swale at court

props.synopsis: All charges against William Swale, who crashed into patrons at a Victorian pub in November 2023, were dismissed last month and will not be reinstated.

title.children: Driver will not be charged again over crash that killed five people outside Daylesford pub

image.altText: NASA’s Perseverance Captures ‘Googly Eye’ During Solar Eclipse

props.synopsis: NASA's Perseverance rover spots a potato-shaped moon passing in front of the Sun during a recent solar eclipse, creating a "googly eye" on Mars.

title.children: NASA Mars rover captures 'Googly Eye' during solar eclipse

image.altText: A woman wearing blue scrubs holds a test tube, and two other women stand at the bench.

props.synopsis: Women in the Pacific are 14 times more likely to die from cervical cancer than in Australia, but there are hopes a record philanthropic donation will change that.

title.children: Record $26 million donation to fight one of the Pacific's biggest causes of death

image.altText: Joel Smith looks disappointed

props.synopsis: Joel Smith has been suspended for more than four years after being found guilty of five violations of the Australian Football Anti-Doping Code.

title.children: Joel Smith handed four-year drugs suspension

image.altText: A photograph of Adolf Hitler against a colourful background

props.synopsis: LSD is a relatively new drug, compared to many others. And its history has been influenced by some unlikely groups.

title.children: 'Fantastic pictures, extraordinary shapes': How LSD was discovered and where it all went wrong

image.altText: A man in paramedic red pants and white shirt consoles another.

props.synopsis: A Palestinian ambulance worker makes a horrific discovery when the corpse he is attending to is revealed as his own mother.

title.children: Gaza medic realises he's carrying his own mother's body while responding to Israeli air strike
